heroSection.title: Small Team. Big Momentum.
heroSection.subtitle: Orange Jelly is a hands-on hospitality growth partner built for action. You work directly with us, not layers of agency people.

story: We are small on purpose. Your money goes into the work, not overhead-heavy offices, management layers, or marketing theatre.
I'm Peter. Billy runs The Anchor in Stanwell Moor day-to-day, and I lead marketing and growth. We see the same trading pressure hospitality operators face every week.
Orange Jelly exists to bring practical, transformative support to other hospitality partners: clear priorities, quick wins, and weekly momentum that shows up in bookings, footfall, and repeat visits.

founderSection.name: Meet Peter Pitcher
bio: I am not here to give generic agency advice. I care about practical action that works in busy operations.
Billy runs The Anchor day-to-day, and I lead marketing and growth while balancing a full-time role in AI marketing leadership. That combination keeps our approach both practical and modern.
You get direct support from people who understand hospitality pressure, care about progress, and are genuinely easy to work with.
founderSection.quote: Disruptive thinking, safe execution. We modernize tired marketing habits without destabilizing day-to-day operations.

faqs.question: What makes Orange Jelly different from a typical agency?
faqs.answer: We are a very small, hands-on team. You work directly with us, and your investment goes into practical delivery, not agency layers or overhead.

faqs.question: Who do you work with?
faqs.answer: We work with hospitality partners including pubs, bars, restaurants, venues, hotels, and event spaces.

faqs.question: What does transformative mean in your work?
faqs.answer: It means a step-change in business performance, not just more activity. We focus on outcomes that show up in bookings, footfall, repeat visits, and revenue.

faqs.question: Are you only focused on AI?
faqs.answer: No. AI is one practical tool inside a wider action-first approach. We only use tools that improve speed and consistency without adding complexity.

faqs.question: How do you keep work practical?
faqs.answer: We test and adapt systems in real hospitality conditions at The Anchor first. If it does not work in real operations, we do not recommend it.

faqs.question: What is your tone when working with partners?
faqs.answer: Warm, commercially sharp, and straight-talking. We keep things clear and practical so decisions happen quickly.
